section.title: Mobicents SIP Servlets Server
section.para: Mobicents SIP (Session Initiation Protocol) Servlets deliver a consistent, open platform on which to develop and deploy portable and distributed SIP and Converged Java Enterprise Edition (JEE) services. The Mobicents SIP Servlets Server is an implementation of the SIP Servlet v1.1 (JSR 289) specification on top of Tomcat and Jboss containers, and it strives to develop interoperability standards between SIP Servlets and the Java Service Logic Execution Environment (JSLEE) so that applications can exploit the strengths of both. The JAIN-SIP Reference Implementation is leveraged as the SIP stack, and Mobicents JSLEE is used as the SLEE implementation.

itemizedlist.title: Features of the Mobicents SIP Servlets Server

listitem.para: conformance with the latest SIP Servlet v1.1 (JSR 289) specification
a current call rate of 100 calls per second over a 24-hour duration: 8,640,000 total calls
failover support
merged SIP and HTTP session management
a browser-based Management Console
a bundled JSLEE/SIP interoperability demonstration application
Mobicents Media Server
extensions such as SUBSCRIBE/NOTIFY, among othersothers

section.title: Downloading and Installing a SIP Servlet-Enabled Tomcat
section.para: The Mobicents SIP Servlets Server is able to run on top of both the Tomcat Servlet Container as well as the JBoss Application Server. Installing the SIP Servlets Server consists in downloading either a customized (SIP Servlet-ized) version of Tomcat, or a customized version of JBoss. This section details how to download, install and run a SIP Servlet-Enabled Tomcat; if you would rather run SIP Servlets in JBoss, go to .

formalpara.title: Differences Between the Standard Tomcat Installation and One Customized for Mobicents SIP Servlets
formalpara.para: Provided here is a list of differences between a standard Tomcat Servlet Container installation and the Mobicents-provided SIP Servlets-customized Tomcat installation. The differences include:

listitem.para: The server.xml configuration file has been modified to provide extended classes to the standard Tomcat container classes, in order to allow SIP applications to be loaded and the SIP stack started.

A dars directory containing the default applications' router properties files for using the SIP Servlet Click-to-Call application (which comes bundled with the release) has been added to the conf directory.
Additional JAR files have been added to enable SIP Servlet functionality. Here is a more-or-less complete list of the JAR files added, sorted by directory:
sip-servlets-spec-1.1.4.jar
jain-sip-api-1.2.1.jar
jain-sip-ri-1.2.1.jar
concurrent-1.3.4.jar
log4j-1.2.14.jar
sip-servlets-impl-0.4.1.jar
You must have sufficient disk space in order to install the customized Tomcat Servlet server.
A working installation of Java 1.5 or higher is required in order to run the SIP Servlet-ized Tomcat server.

Downloading and Installing a SIP Servlet-Enabled JBoss Application Server
section.para: The Mobicents SIP Servlets Server is able to run on top of both the Tomcat Servlet Container as well as the JBoss Application Server. Installing the SIP Servlets Server consists in downloading either a customized (SIP Servlet-ized) version of Tomcat, or a customized version of JBoss. This section details how to download, install and run a SIP Servlet-Enabled JBoss Application Server; if you would rather run SIP Servlets in the more lightweight Tomcat, go to .

formalpara.title: Differences Between a Standard JBoss Installation and One Customized for Mobicents SIP Servlets
formalpara.para: Provided here is a list of differences between a standard JBoss Application Server installation and the Mobicents-provided SIP Servlets-customized JBoss installation. The differences include:

listitem.para: The server/default/deploy directory contains both HTTP and SIP Servlet applications (WAR and SAR files).

The server/default/deploy/jboss-web.deployer unit has been modified to provide extended classes to the standard JBoss container classes, in order to allow SIP applications to be loaded and the SIP stack to be started.

A dars directory containing all of the default applications' router properties files for using the various SIP Servlets applications (which come bundled with the release) has been added to the server/default/conf directory.
a dars directory containing all the default applications router properties files for using the sip servlets applications bundled with the release, has been added to the server/default/conf
Additional JAR files have been added to enable SIP Servlet functionality. Here is a more-or-less complete list of the JAR files added, sorted by directory:
sip-servlets-impl-0.4.1.jar
sip-servlets-spec-1.1.4.jar
jain-sip-api-1.2.1.jar
jain-sip-ri-1.2.1.jar
concurrent-1.3.4.jar
log4j-1.2.14.jar
You must have sufficient disk space in order to install the customized JBoss Application Server.
A working installation of Java 1.5 or higher is required in order to run the SIP Servlet-ized JBoss Application Server.
